page.title: 06MILLS AND MINING
page.content: Mill and Mining Blackhead. In the Downas Valley is still evidence of the Mill building and stones. It was working in living memory.There is evidence of old field walls and ridge and furrow cultivation to the east of the valley. Near the head of the valley tin and copper may have been mined in the 18thC and nearer the sea audits,a leat and a water wheel pit can still be seen. These were worked for some years in the 19th C. There are also some old shafts near beagles point. Look for butchers broom growing round the Mill ruins.
